channel.title: Announcement on Kernelize
channel.description: Recent content in Announcement on Kernelize

item.title: Open Core Ventures announces Kernelize
item.description: Open Core Ventures (OCV) recently announced the launch of Kernelize Inc., a new AI accelerator platform designed to bridge the notorious “CUDA moat” by automating compiler backend generation for a broad range of hardware targets. Kernelize is built on the open-source Triton compiler, which simplifies the development of high-performance GPU kernels in Python, and offers developers a path to optimize their AI workloads without being locked into proprietary CUDA frameworks :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}. Led by founder and CTO Simon Waters—an industry veteran who previously spearheaded AMD’s contributions to Triton and co-created the Catapult C Synthesis tool—Kernelize aims to democratize AI performance by making hardware-agnostic optimization more accessible to both developers and chip manufacturers :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}.
